key.name: tabs-open-position
key.summary: Where to position newly open tabs in browser windows
key.description: If set to “after-current-tab”, then new tabs are inserted after the current tab. If set to “end”, then new tabs are appended to the end of the tab list.

key.name: always-use-location-entry
key.summary: Always use the location entry, instead of the pathbar
key.description: If set to true, then Nautilus browser windows will always use a textual input entry for the location toolbar, instead of the pathbar.

key.name: recursive-search
key.summary: Where to perform recursive search
key.description: In which locations Nautilus should search on subfolders. Available values are “local-only”, “always”, “never”.

key.name: search-filter-time-type
key.summary: Filter the search dates using either last used or last modified
key.description: Filter the search dates using either last used or last modified.

key.name: show-delete-permanently
key.summary: Whether to show a context menu item to delete permanently
key.description: If set to true, then Nautilus will show a delete permanently context menu item to bypass the Trash.

key.name: show-create-link
key.summary: Whether to show context menu items to create links from copied or selected files
key.description: If set to true, then Nautilus will show context menu items to create links from the copied or selected files.

key.name: confirm-trash
key.summary: Whether to ask for confirmation when deleting files, or emptying the Trash
key.description: If set to true, then Nautilus will ask for confirmation when you attempt to delete files, or empty the Trash.

key.name: show-directory-item-counts
key.summary: When to show number of items in a folder
key.description: Speed tradeoff for when to show the number of items in a folder. If set to “always” then always show item counts, even if the folder is on a remote server. If set to “local-only” then only show counts for local file systems. If set to “never” then never bother to compute item counts.

key.name: click-policy
key.summary: Type of click used to launch/open files
key.description: Possible values are “single” to launch files on a single click, or “double” to launch them on a double click.

key.name: executable-text-activation
key.summary: What to do with executable text files when activated
key.description: What to do with executable text files when they are activated (single or double clicked). Possible values are “launch” to launch them as programs, “ask” to ask what to do via a dialog, and “display” to display them as text files.

key.name: install-mime-activation
key.summary: Show the package installer for unknown MIME types
key.description: Whether to show the user a package installer dialog in case an unknown MIME type is opened, in order to search for an application to handle it.

key.name: show-move-to-trash-shortcut-changed-dialog
key.summary: Show a warning dialog for the change of the shortcut for move to the Trash
key.description: Show a warning dialog for the change of the shortcut for move to the Trash from Control + Delete to just Delete.

key.name: mouse-use-extra-buttons
key.summary: Use extra mouse button events in Nautilus’ browser window
key.description: For users with mice that have “Forward” and “Back” buttons, this key will determine if any action is taken inside of Nautilus when either is pressed.

key.name: mouse-forward-button
key.summary: Mouse button to activate the “Forward” command in browser window
key.description: For users with mice that have buttons for “Forward” and “Back”, this key will set which button activates the “Forward” command in a browser window. Possible values range between 6 and 14.

key.name: mouse-back-button
key.summary: Mouse button to activate the “Back” command in browser window
key.description: For users with mice that have buttons for “Forward” and “Back”, this key will set which button activates the “Back” command in a browser window. Possible values range between 6 and 14.

key.name: show-image-thumbnails
key.summary: When to show thumbnails of files
key.description: Speed trade-off for when to show a file as a thumbnail. If set to “always” then always thumbnail, even if the folder is on a remote server. If set to “local-only” then only show thumbnails for local file systems. If set to “never” then never bother to thumbnail files, just use a generic icon. Despite what the name may suggest, this applies to any previewable file type.

key.name: thumbnail-limit
key.summary: Maximum image size for thumbnailing
key.description: Images over this size (in bytes) won’t be thumbnailed. The purpose of this setting is to avoid thumbnailing large images that may take a long time to load or use lots of memory.

key.name: default-sort-order
key.summary: Default sort order
key.description: The default sort-order for items in the icon view. Possible values are “name”, “size”, “type” and “mtime”.

key.name: default-sort-in-reverse-order
key.summary: Reverse sort order in new windows
key.description: If true, files in new windows will be sorted in reverse order. I.e., if sorted by name, then instead of sorting the files from “a” to “z”, they will be sorted from “z” to “a”; if sorted by size, instead of being incrementally they will be sorted decrementally.

key.name: default-folder-viewer
key.summary: Default folder viewer
key.description: When a folder is visited this viewer is used unless you have selected another view for that particular folder. Possible values are “list-view”, and “icon-view”.

key.name: show-hidden-files
key.summary: Whether to show hidden files
key.description: This key is deprecated and ignored. The “show-hidden” key from “org.gtk.Settings.FileChooser” is now used instead.

key.name: search-view
key.summary: What viewer should be used when searching
key.description: When searching Nautilus will switch to the type of view in this setting.

key.name: bulk-rename-tool
key.summary: Bulk rename utility
key.description: If set, Nautilus will append URIs of selected files and treat the result as a command line for bulk renaming. Bulk rename applications can register themselves in this key by setting the key to a space-separated string of their executable name and any command line options. If the executable name is not set to a full path, it will be searched for in the search path.

key.name: open-folder-on-dnd-hover
key.summary: Whether to open the hovered folder after a timeout when drag and drop operation
key.description: If this is set to true, when performing a drag and drop operation the hovered folder will open automatically after a timeout.

key.name: use-experimental-views
key.summary: Enable new experimental views
key.description: Whether to use the new experimental views using the latest GTK+ widgets to help giving feedback and shaping their future.

key.name: fts-default
key.summary: Whether to have full text search enabled by default when opening a new window/tab
key.description: If set to true, then Nautilus will also match the file contents besides the name. This toggles the default active state, which can still be overriden in the search popover

key.name: default-compression-format
key.summary: Default format for compressing files
key.description: The format that will be selected when compressing files.

key.name: captions
key.summary: List of possible captions on icons
key.description: A list of captions below an icon in the icon view and the desktop. The actual number of captions shown depends on the zoom level. Some possible values are: “size”, “type”, “date_modified”, “owner”, “group”, “permissions”, and “mime_type”.

key.name: default-zoom-level
key.summary: Default icon zoom level
key.description: Default zoom level used by the icon view.

key.name: thumbnail-size
key.summary: Default Thumbnail Icon Size
key.description: The default size of an icon for a thumbnail in the icon view when using NAUTILUS_ICON_SIZE_STANDARD size.

key.name: text-ellipsis-limit
key.summary: Text Ellipsis Limit
key.description: A string specifying how parts of overlong file names should be replaced by ellipses, depending on the zoom level. Each of the list entries is of the form “Zoom Level:Integer”. For each specified zoom level, if the given integer is larger than 0, the file name will not exceed the given number of lines. If the integer is 0 or smaller, no limit is imposed on the specified zoom level. A default entry of the form “Integer” without any specified zoom level is also allowed. It defines the maximum number of lines for all other zoom levels. Examples: 0 — always display overlong file names; 3 — shorten file names if they exceed three lines; smallest:5,smaller:4,0 — shorten file names if they exceed five lines for zoom level “smallest”. Shorten file names if they exceed four lines for zoom level “smaller”. Do not shorten file names for other zoom levels. Available zoom levels: small, standard, large.

key.name: default-zoom-level
key.summary: Default list zoom level
key.description: Default zoom level used by the list view.

key.name: default-visible-columns
key.summary: Default list of columns visible in the list view
key.description: Default list of columns visible in the list view.

key.name: default-column-order
key.summary: Default column order in the list view
key.description: Default column order in the list view.

key.name: use-tree-view
key.summary: Use tree view
key.description: Whether a tree should be used for list view navigation instead of a flat list.

key.name: font
key.summary: Desktop font
key.description: The font description used for the icons on the desktop.

key.name: home-icon-visible
key.summary: Home icon visible on desktop
key.description: If this is set to true, an icon linking to the home folder will be put on the desktop.

key.name: trash-icon-visible
key.summary: Trash icon visible on desktop
key.description: If this is set to true, an icon linking to the Trash will be put on the desktop.

key.name: volumes-visible
key.summary: Show mounted volumes on the desktop
key.description: If this is set to true, icons linking to mounted volumes will be put on the desktop.

key.name: network-icon-visible
key.summary: Network Servers icon visible on the desktop
key.description: If this is set to true, an icon linking to the Network Servers view will be put on the desktop.

key.name: home-icon-name
key.summary: Desktop home icon name
key.description: This name can be set if you want a custom name for the home icon on the desktop.

key.name: trash-icon-name
key.summary: Desktop Trash icon name
key.description: This name can be set if you want a custom name for the Trash icon on the desktop.

key.name: network-icon-name
key.summary: Network servers icon name
key.description: This name can be set if you want a custom name for the network servers icon on the desktop.

key.name: text-ellipsis-limit
key.summary: Text Ellipsis Limit
key.description: An integer specifying how parts of overlong file names should be replaced by ellipses on the desktop. If the number is larger than 0, the file name will not exceed the given number of lines. If the number is 0 or smaller, no limit is imposed on the number of displayed lines.

key.name: background-fade
key.summary: Fade the background on change
key.description: If set to true, then Nautilus will use a fade effect to change the desktop background.

key.name: geometry
key.summary: The geometry string for a navigation window
key.description: A string containing the saved geometry and coordinates string for navigation windows.

key.name: maximized
key.summary: Whether the navigation window should be maximized
key.description: Whether the navigation window should be maximized by default.

key.name: sidebar-width
key.summary: Width of the side pane
key.description: The default width of the side pane in new windows.

key.name: start-with-location-bar
key.summary: Show location bar in new windows
key.description: If set to true, newly opened windows will have the location bar visible.

key.name: start-with-sidebar
key.summary: Show side pane in new windows
key.description: If set to true, newly opened windows will have the side pane visible.
